title: R Bindings to the C Grammar for Tree-Sitter
code: # Install  the development version of treesitter.c from r-universe install.packages('treesitter.c', repos = c('https://sounkou-bioinfo.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org')) # or the cran release install.packages('treesitter.c', repos = 'https://cloud.r-project.org')

title: R Bindings to the C Grammar for Tree-Sitter
R Bindings to the C Grammar for Tree-Sitter
text: C compiler available want preprocess macros (recommended headers use macros), enable preprocess = TRUE. Prefer use helper r_cc() detect compiler automatically can use preprocess_header function extra compiler options avoid system includes use bundled fake libc headers. avoids system includes bloat. approach ensures fake libc headers used, making preprocessing predictable portable.
code: # Check for a compiler and use include_dirs so the preprocessor can find nested headers cc <- treesitter.c::r_cc() hdr_df_pp <- parse_r_include_headers(     dir = R.home("include"),     preprocess = TRUE,     include_dirs = R.home("include")   ) hdr_df_pp[grepl("Rf", x = hdr_df_pp$name), ] |> head(10) #>                  name                                   file line        kind #> 1483         Rf_error /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2522 declaration #> 1486       Rf_warning /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2528 declaration #> 1495       Rf_revsort /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2567 declaration #> 1496        Rf_iPsort /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2568 declaration #> 1497        Rf_rPsort /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2569 declaration #> 1498        Rf_cPsort /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2570 declaration #> 1503   Rf_StringFalse /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2586 declaration #> 1504    Rf_StringTrue /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2587 declaration #> 1505 Rf_isBlankString /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2588 declaration #> 1557        Rf_asChar /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Callbacks.h 2922 declaration library(treesitter.c)  # Path to a header file to preprocess header_file <- file.path(R.home("include"), "Rinternals.h")  # Get the path to the fake libc headers fake_libc <- fake_libc_path()  # Preprocess with -nostdinc and -I pointing to fake_libc preprocessed <- preprocess_header(    file = header_file,    cc = r_cc(),     ccflags = paste0("-I", fake_libc),   "-nostdinc" ) cat(substr(preprocessed, 1, 500))  #> # 0 "/usr/share/R/include/Rinternals.h" #> # 0 "<built-in>" #> # 0 "<command-line>" #> # 1 "/usr/share/R/include/Rinternals.h" #> # 38 "/usr/share/R/include/Rinternals.h" #> # 1 "/usr/local/lib/R/site-library/treesitter.c/fake_libc/stdio.h" 1 #> # 1 "/usr/local/lib/R/site-library/treesitter.c/fake_libc/_fake_defines.h" 1 #> # 2 "/usr/local/lib/R/site-library/treesitter.c/fake_libc/stdio.h" 2 #> # 1 "/usr/local/lib/R/site-library/treesitter.c/fake_libc/_fake_typedefs.h" 1 #>  #>  #>  #> typedef int size_t; #> typedef int __builtin_va_

title: R Bindings to the C Grammar for Tree-Sitter
text: following concise examples demonstrate extracting specific information (functions, parameters, structs, macros) using package’s simple helpers. Simple parse extract functions: parse small header string extract functions parameter types. Extract function parameter return types parsing: Get structs members: Collect directory kinds using parse_headers_collect
code: txt <- "int foo(int a, const char* s); static inline int bar(void) { return 1; }" # extract params and return type root <- parse_header_text(txt) get_function_nodes(root, extract_params = TRUE, extract_return = TRUE) #>   capture_name text start_line start_col       params return_type #> 1    decl_name  foo          1         5 int, con....         int #> 2     def_name  bar          2        19         void         int get_function_nodes(root, extract_params = TRUE) #>   capture_name text start_line start_col       params return_type #> 1    decl_name  foo          1         5 int, con....        <NA> #> 2     def_name  bar          2        19         void        <NA> txt <- "int foo(int a, const char* s);" root <- parse_header_text(txt) get_function_nodes(root, extract_params = TRUE, extract_return = TRUE) #>   capture_name text start_line start_col       params return_type #> 1    decl_name  foo          1         5 int, con....         int txt <- "struct T { unsigned int x:1; int y; };" root <- parse_header_text(txt) get_struct_nodes(root) #>   capture_name text start_line #> 1  struct_name    T          1 get_struct_members(root) #>   struct_name member_name member_type bitfield nested_members #> 1           T           x        <NA>        1           <NA> #> 2           T           y         int     <NA>           <NA> res <- parse_headers_collect(dir = R.home("include"), preprocess = FALSE, extract_params = TRUE) names(res) #> [1] "functions"      "structs"        "struct_members" "enums"          #> [5] "unions"         "globals"        "defines" head(res$functions) #>                                  file capture_name start_line start_col #> 1 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         47         1 #> 2 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         50         1 #> 3 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         52         1 #> 4 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         54         1 #> 5 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         56         1 #> 6 /usr/share/R/include/R_ext/Altrep.h    decl_name         58         1 #>         params return_type                    name #> 1 R_altrep....        <NA>            R_new_altrep #> 2 const ch....        <NA>  R_make_altstring_class #> 3 const ch....        <NA> R_make_altinteger_class #> 4 const ch....        <NA>    R_make_altreal_class #> 5 const ch....        <NA> R_make_altlogical_class #> 6 const ch....        <NA>     R_make_altraw_class # Optional: inspect macros from a single header path <- file.path(R.home("include"), "Rembedded.h") defs <- get_defines_from_file(path, use_cpp = TRUE, ccflags = paste("-I", dirname(path)))   head(defs) #> [1] "__DBL_MIN_EXP__"         "__UINT_LEAST16_MAX__"    #> [3] "_STDBOOL_H"              "__FLT16_HAS_QUIET_NAN__" #> [5] "__ATOMIC_ACQUIRE"        "__FLT128_MAX_10_EXP__"

title: R Bindings to the C Grammar for Tree-Sitter
text: treesiter ABI Version 14, compatible treesitter package version 0.3.0. C grammar source used bootstrapping downloaded https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter-c. pre-generated parser.c upstream ~3.7 MB contains pragma directives trigger CRAN check warnings. bootstrap (bootstrap.R), #pragma directives automatically removed parser.c ensure CRAN compliance. includes pragmas diagnostic control optimization settings portable across compilers.

title: Parse a directory of headers and return named list of data.frames with — parse_headers_collect
code: parse_headers_collect(   dir = R.home("include"),   recursive = TRUE,   pattern = c("\\.h$", "\\.H$"),   preprocess = FALSE,   cc = r_cc(),   ccflags = NULL,   include_dirs = NULL,   extract_params = FALSE,   extract_return = FALSE,   ... )

title: Parse a directory of headers and return named list of data.frames with — parse_headers_collect
text: dir Directory search header files. Defaults R.home("include"). recursive Whether search recursively headers. Default TRUE. pattern File name pattern match header files. Default \.h$ \.H$. preprocess Run C preprocessor (using R's configured CC) header files parsing. Defaults FALSE. cc C compiler use preprocessing. NULL function queries R CMD config CC falls back Sys.getenv("CC") cc PATH. ccflags Extra flags pass compiler preprocessing. NULL flags taken R CMD config CFLAGS R CMD config CPPFLAGS. include_dirs Additional directories add include path preprocessing. character vector directories. extract_params Logical; whether extract parameter types functions. Default FALSE. extract_return Logical; whether extract return types functions. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed preprocess_header (e.g., extra compiler flags)

title: Parse a directory of headers and return named list of data.frames with — parse_headers_collect
text: named list data frames components: functions, structs, struct_members, enums, unions, globals, defines.

title: Parse a directory of headers and return named list of data.frames with — parse_headers_collect
text: helper loops headers found directory returns list tidy data.frames. Useful programmatic analysis header collections.

title: Parse a directory of headers and return named list of data.frames with — parse_headers_collect
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (requireNamespace("treesitter", quietly = TRUE)) {     res <- parse_headers_collect(dir = R.home("include"), preprocess = FALSE)     head(res$functions) } } # }

what: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
title: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
text: utility uses C language provided package treesitter parser find function declarations definitions C header files. default dir R.home("include"), typically R's headers live.

title: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
code: parse_r_include_headers(   dir = R.home("include"),   recursive = TRUE,   pattern = c("\\.h$", "\\.H$"),   preprocess = FALSE,   cc = r_cc(),   ccflags = NULL,   include_dirs = NULL,   ... )

title: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
text: dir Directory search header files. Defaults R.home("include"). recursive Whether search recursively headers. Default TRUE. pattern File name pattern match header files. Default \.h$ \.H$. preprocess Run C preprocessor (using R's configured CC) header files parsing. Defaults FALSE. cc C compiler use preprocessing. NULL function queries R CMD config CC falls back Sys.getenv("CC") cc PATH. ccflags Extra flags pass compiler preprocessing. NULL flags taken R CMD config CFLAGS R CMD config CPPFLAGS. include_dirs Additional directories add include path preprocessing. character vector directories. ... Arguments passed parse_headers_collect extract_params Logical; whether extract parameter types functions. Default FALSE. extract_return Logical; whether extract return types functions. Default FALSE.

title: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
text: data frame columns name, file, line, kind (either 'declaration' 'definition').

title: Parse C header files for function declarations using tree-sitter — parse_r_include_headers
code: if (requireNamespace("treesitter", quietly = TRUE)) {     # Parse a small header file from a temp dir     tmp <- tempdir()     path <- file.path(tmp, "example.h")     writeLines(c(         "int foo(int a);",         "static inline int bar(void) { return 1; }"     ), path)     parse_r_include_headers(dir = tmp) } #>   name                      file line        kind #> 1  foo /tmp/RtmpNHHy5O/example.h    1 declaration #> 2  bar /tmp/RtmpNHHy5O/example.h    2  definition

what: Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
title: Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
text: function runs configured C compiler -E preprocessor flag returns combined preprocessed output single string.

title: Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
text: file Path header file preprocess. cc (Character) Compiler command use. NULL, resolved via r_cc(). ccflags (Character) Additional flags pass compiler. ... Arguments passed preprocess_headers dir Directory header files searched. recursive Logical; whether search recursively. pattern File name pattern(s) used identify header files.

title: Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
text: Character scalar preprocessed output file.

title: Run the C preprocessor on file using the provided compiler — preprocess_header
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Check for a compiler before running an example that invokes the preprocessor rcc <- treesitter.c::r_cc() if (nzchar(rcc)) {     rcc_prog <- strsplit(rcc, "\\s+")[[1]][1]     if (nzchar(Sys.which(rcc_prog))) {         tmp <- tempfile("hdr3")         dir.create(tmp)         path <- file.path(tmp, "p.h")         writeLines(c("#define TYPE int", "TYPE foo(TYPE x);"), path)         out <- preprocess_header(path)         grepl("int foo\\(", out)     } else {         message("Skipping preprocess example: compiler not found on PATH")     } } } # }

what: Preprocess a set of header files found under dir — preprocess_headers
title: Preprocess a set of header files found under dir — preprocess_headers
text: helper calls preprocess_header() matching file dir returns named list path keys preprocessed text values.

title: Preprocess a set of header files found under dir — preprocess_headers
code: preprocess_headers(   dir = R.home("include"),   recursive = TRUE,   pattern = c("\\.h$", "\\.H$"),   cc = r_cc(),   ccflags = NULL,   ... )

title: Preprocess a set of header files found under dir — preprocess_headers
text: dir Directory header files searched. recursive Logical; whether search recursively. pattern File name pattern(s) used identify header files. cc Compiler string; passed preprocess_header. ccflags Compiler flags; passed preprocess_header. ... Arguments passed parse_r_include_headers preprocess Run C preprocessor (using R's configured CC) header files parsing. Defaults FALSE. include_dirs Additional directories add include path preprocessing. character vector directories.

title: Preprocess a set of header files found under dir — preprocess_headers
text: Named list file => preprocessed text.

what: Return the default R-configured C compiler (possibly with flags) — r_cc
title: Return the default R-configured C compiler (possibly with flags) — r_cc
text: function queries common places find C compiler used R. checks Sys.getenv("CC"), R CMD config CC, finally cc PATH. returned value may include flags (e.g., 'gcc -std=...').

title: Return the default R-configured C compiler (possibly with flags) — r_cc
Return the default R-configured C compiler (possibly with flags) — r_cc
text: Character scalar compiler program (empty string).

what: treesitter.c: 'R' Bindings to the 'C' Grammar for Tree-Sitter — treesitter.c-package
title: treesitter.c: 'R' Bindings to the 'C' Grammar for Tree-Sitter — treesitter.c-package
text: Provides bindings 'C' grammar Tree-sitter, used alongside 'treesitter' package. Tree-sitter builds concrete syntax trees source files can efficiently update generate code like producing R C API wrappers C functions, structs global definitions header files.

title: treesitter.c: 'R' Bindings to the 'C' Grammar for Tree-Sitter — treesitter.c-package
text: Maintainer: Sounkou Mahamane Toure sounkoutoure@gmail.com contributors: Tree-sitter authors (Tree-sitter C grammar) [copyright holder] Eli Bendersky Co-authors (pycparser fake_libc headers) [copyright holder]

title: treesitter.c 0.0.2.9000 (Development)
text: Basic parsing facilities C headers Using r_cc preprocessing Added pycparser’s fake_libc headers (Eli Bendersky Co-authors) inst/fake_libc improved preprocessing C headers System headers bloat.

title: treesitter.c 0.0.1 (CRAN Submission)
text: CRAN release: 2025-12-10 Initial CRAN submission
